chapter.title: Overview
chapter.para: This plugin comes packaged with Groovy, a dynamic scripting language for the JVM.

chapter.title: Using with Console
chapter.para: If the Console plugin is installed, this plugin automatically sets the system environment variable GROOVY to the path of groovy. So to run a script called 'script.groovy', cd to the file's directory (cd $d) and run:

Alternatively, this plugin provides an enhanced groovy commando file and sets it as the default interpreter for the groovy edit mode. To use it, open up a groovy file and go to Plugins -> Console -> Run Current Buffer.
